adjectives.description: confidential (comparative more confidential, superlative most confidential)

entries.meaning: Kept, or meant to be kept, secret within a certain circle of persons; not intended to be known publicly
examples: Synonyms: private, classified, off the record, privileged, secret, dern (obsolete)
The newspaper claims a leaked confidential report by the government admits to problems with corrupt MPs.

entries.meaning: (dated) Inclined to share confidences; (of things) making people inclined to share confidences; involving the sharing of confidences.
examples: Sitting in front of the fire, they became quite confidential, and began to gossip.

entries.meaning: (dated) Having someone's confidence or trust; having a position requiring trust; worthy of being trusted with confidences.
examples: a confidential agent; a confidential servant; a confidential whisper
